trans-unit.source: Graphical Authoring in Azure Automation
trans-unit.target: Graphical Authoring in Azure Automation

trans-unit.source: Graphical authoring allows you to create runbooks for Azure Automation without working with code. This article provides an introduction to graphical authoring and all the details needed to start creating a graphical runbook.
trans-unit.target: Graphical authoring allows you to create runbooks for Azure Automation without working with code. This article provides an introduction to graphical authoring and all the details needed to start creating a graphical runbook.

trans-unit.source: Graphical Authoring allows you to create runbooks for Azure Automation without the complexities of the underlying Windows PowerShell Workflow code.
trans-unit.target: Graphical Authoring allows you to create runbooks for Azure Automation without the complexities of the underlying Windows PowerShell Workflow code.

trans-unit.source: You add activities from a library of cmdlets and other activities to a canvas and link them together to form a workflow.
trans-unit.target: You add activities from a library of cmdlets and other activities to a canvas and link them together to form a workflow.

trans-unit.source: This article provides an introduction to graphical authoring and the concepts you need to get started in creating a graphical runbook.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an introduction to graphical authoring and the concepts you need to get started in creating a graphical runbook.

trans-unit.source: All runbooks in Azure Automation are Windows PowerShell Workflows.
trans-unit.target: All runbooks in Azure Automation are Windows PowerShell Workflows.

trans-unit.source: Graphical runbooks generate PowerShell code that is run by the Automation workers, but you are not able to view it or directly modify it.
trans-unit.target: Graphical runbooks generate PowerShell code that is run by the Automation workers, but you are not able to view it or directly modify it.

trans-unit.source: Graphical runbooks cannot be converted to textual runbooks, nor can an existing textual runbook be imported into the graphical editor.
trans-unit.target: Graphical runbooks cannot be converted to textual runbooks, nor can an existing textual runbook be imported into the graphical editor.

trans-unit.source: You can open the graphical editor in the Azure preview portal by creating or editing a graphical runbook.
trans-unit.target: You can open the graphical editor in the Azure preview portal by creating or editing a graphical runbook.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Graphical workspace</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Graphical workspace</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe the controls in the graphical editor.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe the controls in the graphical editor.

trans-unit.source: The Canvas is where you design your runbook.
trans-unit.target: The Canvas is where you design your runbook.

trans-unit.source: You add activities from the nodes in the Library control to the runbook and connect them with links to define the logic of the runbook.
trans-unit.target: You add activities from the nodes in the Library control to the runbook and connect them with links to define the logic of the runbook.

trans-unit.source: The Library control is where you select <linkText>activities</linkText><title></title> to add to your runbook.
trans-unit.target: The Library control is where you select <linkText>activities</linkText><title></title> to add to your runbook.

trans-unit.source: You add them to the canvas where you connect them to other activities.
trans-unit.target: You add them to the canvas where you connect them to other activities.

trans-unit.source: It includes four sections described in the following table.
trans-unit.target: It includes four sections described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Section
trans-unit.target: Section

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Cmdlets
trans-unit.target: Cmdlets

trans-unit.source: Includes all the cmdlets that can be used in your runbook.
trans-unit.target: Includes all the cmdlets that can be used in your runbook.

trans-unit.source: Cmdlets are organized by module.
trans-unit.target: Cmdlets are organized by module.

trans-unit.source: All of the modules that you have installed in your automation account will be available.
trans-unit.target: All of the modules that you have installed in your automation account will be available.

trans-unit.source: Runbooks
trans-unit.target: Runbooks

trans-unit.source: Includes the runbooks in your automation account organized by tag.
trans-unit.target: Includes the runbooks in your automation account organized by tag.

trans-unit.source: Since a runbook can have more than one tag, it may be listed under multiple tags These runbooks can be added to the canvas to be used as a child runbook.
trans-unit.target: Since a runbook can have more than one tag, it may be listed under multiple tags These runbooks can be added to the canvas to be used as a child runbook.

trans-unit.source: The runbook currently being edited is displayed but cannot be added to the canvas since a runbook cannot call itself.
trans-unit.target: The runbook currently being edited is displayed but cannot be added to the canvas since a runbook cannot call itself.

trans-unit.source: Assets
trans-unit.target: Assets

trans-unit.source: Includes the <linkText>automation assets</linkText><title></title> in your automation account that can be used in your runbook.
trans-unit.target: Includes the <linkText>automation assets</linkText><title></title> in your automation account that can be used in your runbook.

trans-unit.source: When you add an asset to a runbook, it will add a workflow activity that gets the selected asset.
trans-unit.target: When you add an asset to a runbook, it will add a workflow activity that gets the selected asset.

trans-unit.source: In the case of variable assets, you can select whether to add an activity to get the variable or set the variable.
trans-unit.target: In the case of variable assets, you can select whether to add an activity to get the variable or set the variable.

trans-unit.source: Runbook Control
trans-unit.target: Runbook Control

trans-unit.source: Includes runbook control activities that can be used in your current runbook.
trans-unit.target: Includes runbook control activities that can be used in your current runbook.

trans-unit.source: A junction takes multiple inputs and waits until all have completed before continuing the workflow.
trans-unit.target: A junction takes multiple inputs and waits until all have completed before continuing the workflow.

trans-unit.source: A workflow script runs one or more lines of PowerShell Workflow code.
trans-unit.target: A workflow script runs one or more lines of PowerShell Workflow code.

trans-unit.source: You can use this activity for custom code or for functionality that you cannot achieve with other activities.
trans-unit.target: You can use this activity for custom code or for functionality that you cannot achieve with other activities.

trans-unit.source: The Configuration control is where you provide details for an object selected on the canvas The properties available in this control will depend on the type of object selected.
trans-unit.target: The Configuration control is where you provide details for an object selected on the canvas The properties available in this control will depend on the type of object selected.

trans-unit.source: When you select an option in the Configuration control, it will open additional blades in order to provide additional information.
trans-unit.target: When you select an option in the Configuration control, it will open additional blades in order to provide additional information.

trans-unit.source: The Test control is not displayed when the graphical editor is first started.
trans-unit.target: The Test control is not displayed when the graphical editor is first started.

trans-unit.source: It is opened when you interactively <linkText>test a graphical runbook</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: It is opened when you interactively <linkText>test a graphical runbook</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can test the Draft version of a runbook in the Azure preview portal while leaving the published version of the runbook unchanged, or you can test a new runbook before it has been published.
trans-unit.target: You can test the Draft version of a runbook in the Azure preview portal while leaving the published version of the runbook unchanged, or you can test a new runbook before it has been published.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to verify that the runbook is working correctly before replacing the published version.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to verify that the runbook is working correctly before replacing the published version.

trans-unit.source: When you test a runbook, the Draft runbook is executed and any actions that it performs are completed.
trans-unit.target: When you test a runbook, the Draft runbook is executed and any actions that it performs are completed.

trans-unit.source: No job history is created, but output is displayed in the Test Output Pane.
trans-unit.target: No job history is created, but output is displayed in the Test Output Pane.

trans-unit.source: Open the Test control for a runbook by opening the runbook for edit and then click on the Test pane button.
trans-unit.target: Open the Test control for a runbook by opening the runbook for edit and then click on the Test pane button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Test pane button</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Test pane button</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Test control will prompt for any input parameters, and you can start the runbook by clicking on the Start button.
trans-unit.target: The Test control will prompt for any input parameters, and you can start the runbook by clicking on the Start button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Test control buttons</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Test control buttons</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Each runbook in Azure Automation has a Draft and a Published version.
trans-unit.target: Each runbook in Azure Automation has a Draft and a Published version.

trans-unit.source: Only the Published version is available to be run, and only the Draft version can be edited.
trans-unit.target: Only the Published version is available to be run, and only the Draft version can be edited.

trans-unit.source: The Published version is unaffected by any changes to the Draft version.
trans-unit.target: The Published version is unaffected by any changes to the Draft version.

trans-unit.source: When the Draft version is ready to be available, then you publish it which overwrites the Published version with the Draft version.
trans-unit.target: When the Draft version is ready to be available, then you publish it which overwrites the Published version with the Draft version.

trans-unit.source: You can publish a graphical runbook by opening the runbook for editing and then clicking on the Publish button.
trans-unit.target: You can publish a graphical runbook by opening the runbook for editing and then clicking on the Publish button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publish button</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publish button</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When a runbook has not yet been published, it has a status of New.
trans-unit.target: When a runbook has not yet been published, it has a status of New.

trans-unit.source: When it is published, it has a status of Published.
trans-unit.target: When it is published, it has a status of Published.

trans-unit.source: If you edit the runbook after it has been published, and the Draft and Published versions are different, the runbook has a status of In edit.
trans-unit.target: If you edit the runbook after it has been published, and the Draft and Published versions are different, the runbook has a status of In edit.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Runbook statuses</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Runbook statuses</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You also have the option to revert to the Published version of a runbook.
trans-unit.target: You also have the option to revert to the Published version of a runbook.

trans-unit.source: This throws away any changes made since the runbook was last published and replaces the Draft version of the runbook with the Published version.
trans-unit.target: This throws away any changes made since the runbook was last published and replaces the Draft version of the runbook with the Published version.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Revert to published button</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Revert to published button</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Activities are the building blocks of a runbook.
trans-unit.target: Activities are the building blocks of a runbook.

trans-unit.source: An activity can be a PowerShell cmdlet, a child runbook, or a workflow activity.
trans-unit.target: An activity can be a PowerShell cmdlet, a child runbook, or a workflow activity.

trans-unit.source: You add an activity to the runbook by right clicking it in the Library control and selecting Add to canvas.
trans-unit.target: You add an activity to the runbook by right clicking it in the Library control and selecting Add to canvas.

trans-unit.source: You can then click and drag the activity to place it anywhere on the canvas that you like.
trans-unit.target: You can then click and drag the activity to place it anywhere on the canvas that you like.

trans-unit.source: The location of the of the activity on the canvas does not effect the operation of the runbook in any way.
trans-unit.target: The location of the of the activity on the canvas does not effect the operation of the runbook in any way.

trans-unit.source: You can layout your runbook however you find it most suitable to visualize its operation.
trans-unit.target: You can layout your runbook however you find it most suitable to visualize its operation.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add to canvas</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add to canvas</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the activity on the canvas to configure its properties and parameters in the Configuration blade.
trans-unit.target: Select the activity on the canvas to configure its properties and parameters in the Configuration blade.

trans-unit.source: You can change the Label of the activity to something that is descriptive to you.
trans-unit.target: You can change the Label of the activity to something that is descriptive to you.

trans-unit.source: The original cmdlet is still being run, you are simply changing its display name that will be used in the graphical editor.
trans-unit.target: The original cmdlet is still being run, you are simply changing its display name that will be used in the graphical editor.

trans-unit.source: The label must be unique within the runbook.
trans-unit.target: The label must be unique within the runbook.

trans-unit.source: A parameter set defines the mandatory and optional parameters that will accept values for a particular cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: A parameter set defines the mandatory and optional parameters that will accept values for a particular cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: All cmdlets have at least one parameter set, and some have multiple.
trans-unit.target: All cmdlets have at least one parameter set, and some have multiple.

trans-unit.source: If a cmdlet has multiple parameter sets, then you must select which one you will use before you can configure parameters.
trans-unit.target: If a cmdlet has multiple parameter sets, then you must select which one you will use before you can configure parameters.

trans-unit.source: The parameters that you can configure will depend on the parameter set that you choose.
trans-unit.target: The parameters that you can configure will depend on the parameter set that you choose.

trans-unit.source: You can change the parameter set used by an activity by selecting Parameter Set and selecting another set.
trans-unit.target: You can change the parameter set used by an activity by selecting Parameter Set and selecting another set.

trans-unit.source: In this case, any parameter values that you configured are lost.
trans-unit.target: In this case, any parameter values that you configured are lost.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the Get-AzureVM cmdlet has two parameter sets.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, the Get-AzureVM cmdlet has two parameter sets.

trans-unit.source: You cannot configure parameter values until you select one of the parameter sets.
trans-unit.target: You cannot configure parameter values until you select one of the parameter sets.

trans-unit.source: The ListAllVMs parameter set is for returning all virtual machines and has a single optional parameter.
trans-unit.target: The ListAllVMs parameter set is for returning all virtual machines and has a single optional parameter.

trans-unit.source: The GetVMByServiceand VMName is for specifying the virtual machine you want to return and has one mandatory and two optional parameters.
trans-unit.target: The GetVMByServiceand VMName is for specifying the virtual machine you want to return and has one mandatory and two optional parameters.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Parameter set</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Parameter set</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you specify a value for a parameter, you select a data source to determine how the value will be specified.
trans-unit.target: When you specify a value for a parameter, you select a data source to determine how the value will be specified.

trans-unit.source: The data sources that are available for a particular parameter will depend on the valid values for that parameter.
trans-unit.target: The data sources that are available for a particular parameter will depend on the valid values for that parameter.

trans-unit.source: For example, Null will not be an available option for a parameter that does not allow null values.
trans-unit.target: For example, Null will not be an available option for a parameter that does not allow null values.

trans-unit.source: Data Source
trans-unit.target: Data Source

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Constant Value
trans-unit.target: Constant Value

trans-unit.source: Type in a value for the parameter.
trans-unit.target: Type in a value for the parameter.

trans-unit.source: This is only available for the following data types: Int32,Int64,String,Boolean,DateTime,Switch.
trans-unit.target: This is only available for the following data types: Int32,Int64,String,Boolean,DateTime,Switch.

trans-unit.source: Activity Output
trans-unit.target: Activity Output

trans-unit.source: Output from an activity that precedes the current activity in the workflow.
trans-unit.target: Output from an activity that precedes the current activity in the workflow.

trans-unit.source: All valid activities will be listed.
trans-unit.target: All valid activities will be listed.

trans-unit.source: Select just the activity to use its output for the parameter value.
trans-unit.target: Select just the activity to use its output for the parameter value.

trans-unit.source: If the activity outputs an object with multiple properties, then you can type in the name of the property after selecting the activity.
trans-unit.target: If the activity outputs an object with multiple properties, then you can type in the name of the property after selecting the activity.

trans-unit.source: Runbook Input Parameter
trans-unit.target: Runbook Input Parameter

trans-unit.source: Select a runbook input parameter as input to the activity parameter.
trans-unit.target: Select a runbook input parameter as input to the activity parameter.

trans-unit.source: Automation Variable Asset
trans-unit.target: Automation Variable Asset

trans-unit.source: Select an Automation Variable as input.
trans-unit.target: Select an Automation Variable as input.

trans-unit.source: Automation Credential Asset
trans-unit.target: Automation Credential Asset

trans-unit.source: Select an Automation Credential as input.
trans-unit.target: Select an Automation Credential as input.

trans-unit.source: Automation Certificate Asset
trans-unit.target: Automation Certificate Asset

trans-unit.source: Select an Automation Certificate as input.
trans-unit.target: Select an Automation Certificate as input.

trans-unit.source: Automation Connection Asset
trans-unit.target: Automation Connection Asset

trans-unit.source: Select an Automation Connection as input.
trans-unit.target: Select an Automation Connection as input.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell Expression
trans-unit.target: PowerShell Expression

trans-unit.source: Specify simple PowerShell expression.
trans-unit.target: Specify simple PowerShell expression.

trans-unit.source: The expression will be evaluated before the activity and the result used for the parameter value.
trans-unit.target: The expression will be evaluated before the activity and the result used for the parameter value.

trans-unit.source: You can use variables to refer to the output of an activity or a runbook input parameter.
trans-unit.target: You can use variables to refer to the output of an activity or a runbook input parameter.

trans-unit.source: Empty String
trans-unit.target: Empty String

trans-unit.source: An empty string value.
trans-unit.target: An empty string value.

trans-unit.source: Null
trans-unit.target: Null

trans-unit.source: A Null value.
trans-unit.target: A Null value.

trans-unit.source: Unselect
trans-unit.target: Unselect

trans-unit.source: Clears any value that was previously configured.
trans-unit.target: Clears any value that was previously configured.

trans-unit.source: All cmdlets will have the option to provide additional parameters.
trans-unit.target: All cmdlets will have the option to provide additional parameters.

trans-unit.source: These are PowerShell common parameters or other custom parameters.
trans-unit.target: These are PowerShell common parameters or other custom parameters.

trans-unit.source: You are presented with a text box where you can provide parameters using PowerShell syntax.
trans-unit.target: You are presented with a text box where you can provide parameters using PowerShell syntax.

trans-unit.source: For example, to use the Verbose common parameter, you would specify "-Verbose:$True".
trans-unit.target: For example, to use the Verbose common parameter, you would specify "-Verbose:$True".

trans-unit.source: A Workflow Script control is a special activity that accepts PowerShell Workflow code in order to provide functionality that may otherwise not be available.
trans-unit.target: A Workflow Script control is a special activity that accepts PowerShell Workflow code in order to provide functionality that may otherwise not be available.

trans-unit.source: This is not a complete workflow but must contain valid lines of PowerShell Workflow code.
trans-unit.target: This is not a complete workflow but must contain valid lines of PowerShell Workflow code.

trans-unit.source: It cannot accept parameters, but it can use variables for activity output and runbook input parameters.
trans-unit.target: It cannot accept parameters, but it can use variables for activity output and runbook input parameters.

trans-unit.source: Any output of the activity is added to the databus unless it has no outgoing link in which case it is added to the output of the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Any output of the activity is added to the databus unless it has no outgoing link in which case it is added to the output of the runbook.

trans-unit.source: For example the following code performs date calculations using a runbook input variable called $NumberOfDays.
trans-unit.target: For example the following code performs date calculations using a runbook input variable called $NumberOfDays.

trans-unit.source: It then sends a calculated date time as output to be used by subsequent activities in the runbook.
trans-unit.target: It then sends a calculated date time as output to be used by subsequent activities in the runbook.

trans-unit.source: A link in a graphical runbook connects two activities.
trans-unit.target: A link in a graphical runbook connects two activities.

trans-unit.source: It is displayed on the canvas as an arrow pointing from the source activity to the destination activity.
trans-unit.target: It is displayed on the canvas as an arrow pointing from the source activity to the destination activity.

trans-unit.source: The activities run in the direction of the arrow with the destination activity starting after the source activity completes.
trans-unit.target: The activities run in the direction of the arrow with the destination activity starting after the source activity completes.

trans-unit.source: Create a link between two activities by selecting the source activity and clicking the circle at the bottom of the shape.
trans-unit.target: Create a link between two activities by selecting the source activity and clicking the circle at the bottom of the shape.

trans-unit.source: Drag the arrow to the destination activity and release.
trans-unit.target: Drag the arrow to the destination activity and release.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a link</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a link</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the link to configure its properties in the Configuration blade.
trans-unit.target: Select the link to configure its properties in the Configuration blade.

trans-unit.source: This will include the link type which is described in the following table.
trans-unit.target: This will include the link type which is described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Link Type
trans-unit.target: Link Type

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Pipeline
trans-unit.target: Pipeline

trans-unit.source: The destination activity is run once for each object output from the source activity.
trans-unit.target: The destination activity is run once for each object output from the source activity.

trans-unit.source: The destination activity does not run if the source activity results in no output.
trans-unit.target: The destination activity does not run if the source activity results in no output.

trans-unit.source: Output from the source activity is available as an object.
trans-unit.target: Output from the source activity is available as an object.

trans-unit.source: Sequence
trans-unit.target: Sequence

trans-unit.source: The destination activity runs only once.
trans-unit.target: The destination activity runs only once.

trans-unit.source: It receives an array of objects from the source activity.
trans-unit.target: It receives an array of objects from the source activity.

trans-unit.source: Output from the source activity is available as an array of objects.
trans-unit.target: Output from the source activity is available as an array of objects.

trans-unit.source: A graphical runbook will start with any activities that do not have an incoming link.
trans-unit.target: A graphical runbook will start with any activities that do not have an incoming link.

trans-unit.source: This will often be only one activity which would act as the starting activity for the runbook.
trans-unit.target: This will often be only one activity which would act as the starting activity for the runbook.

trans-unit.source: If multiple activities do not have an incoming link, then the runbook will start by running them in parallel.
trans-unit.target: If multiple activities do not have an incoming link, then the runbook will start by running them in parallel.

trans-unit.source: It will then follow the links to run other activities as each completes.
trans-unit.target: It will then follow the links to run other activities as each completes.

trans-unit.source: When you specify a condition on a link, the destination activity is only run if the condition resolves to true.
trans-unit.target: When you specify a condition on a link, the destination activity is only run if the condition resolves to true.

trans-unit.source: You will typically use an $ActivityOutput variable in a condition to retrieve the output from the source activity.
trans-unit.target: You will typically use an $ActivityOutput variable in a condition to retrieve the output from the source activity.

trans-unit.source: For a pipeline link, you specify a condition for a single object, and the condition is evaluated for each object output by the source activity.
trans-unit.target: For a pipeline link, you specify a condition for a single object, and the condition is evaluated for each object output by the source activity.

trans-unit.source: The destination activity is then run for each object that satisfies the condition.
trans-unit.target: The destination activity is then run for each object that satisfies the condition.

trans-unit.source: For example, with a source activity of Get-AzureVM, the following syntax could be used for a conditional pipeline link to retrieve only virtual machines that are currently running.
trans-unit.target: For example, with a source activity of Get-AzureVM, the following syntax could be used for a conditional pipeline link to retrieve only virtual machines that are currently running.

trans-unit.source: For a sequence link, the condition is only evaluated once since a single array is returned containing all objects output from the source activity.
trans-unit.target: For a sequence link, the condition is only evaluated once since a single array is returned containing all objects output from the source activity.

trans-unit.source: Because of this, a sequence link cannot be used for filtering like a pipeline link but will simply determine whether or not the next activity is run.
trans-unit.target: Because of this, a sequence link cannot be used for filtering like a pipeline link but will simply determine whether or not the next activity is run.

trans-unit.source: The following code shows the same example of evaluating output from Get-AzureVM to determine virtual machines that are running.
trans-unit.target: The following code shows the same example of evaluating output from Get-AzureVM to determine virtual machines that are running.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the code walks through each object in the array and resolves to true if at least one virtual machine is running.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the code walks through each object in the array and resolves to true if at least one virtual machine is running.

trans-unit.source: The destination activity would be responsible for parsing this data.
trans-unit.target: The destination activity would be responsible for parsing this data.

trans-unit.source: When you use a conditional link, the data available from the source activity to other activities in that branch will be filtered by the condition.
trans-unit.target: When you use a conditional link, the data available from the source activity to other activities in that branch will be filtered by the condition.

trans-unit.source: If an activity is the source to multiple links, then the data available to activities in each branch will depend on the condition in the link connecting to that branch.
trans-unit.target: If an activity is the source to multiple links, then the data available to activities in each branch will depend on the condition in the link connecting to that branch.

trans-unit.source: For example, the source activity in the runbook below gets all virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: For example, the source activity in the runbook below gets all virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: It has two conditional links and a link without a condition.
trans-unit.target: It has two conditional links and a link without a condition.

trans-unit.source: The first conditional link uses the expression $ActivityOutput['Get-AzureVM'].PowerState -eq 'Started' to filter only virtual machines that are currently running.
trans-unit.target: The first conditional link uses the expression $ActivityOutput['Get-AzureVM'].PowerState -eq 'Started' to filter only virtual machines that are currently running.

trans-unit.source: The second uses the expression $ActivityOutput['Get-AzureVM'].PowerState -eq 'Stopped' to filter only virtual machines that are currently stopped.
trans-unit.target: The second uses the expression $ActivityOutput['Get-AzureVM'].PowerState -eq 'Stopped' to filter only virtual machines that are currently stopped.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Conditional link example</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Conditional link example</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Any activity that follows the first link and uses the activity output from Get-AzureVM will only get the virtual machines that were started at the time that Get-AzureVM was run.
trans-unit.target: Any activity that follows the first link and uses the activity output from Get-AzureVM will only get the virtual machines that were started at the time that Get-AzureVM was run.

trans-unit.source: Any activity that follows the second link will only get the the virtual machines that were stopped at the time that Get-AzureVM was run.
trans-unit.target: Any activity that follows the second link will only get the the virtual machines that were stopped at the time that Get-AzureVM was run.

trans-unit.source: Any activity following the third link will get all virtual machines regardless of their running state.
trans-unit.target: Any activity following the third link will get all virtual machines regardless of their running state.

trans-unit.source: A junction is a special activity that will wait until all incoming branches have completed.
trans-unit.target: A junction is a special activity that will wait until all incoming branches have completed.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to run multiple activities in parallel and ensure that all have completed before moving on.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to run multiple activities in parallel and ensure that all have completed before moving on.

trans-unit.source: While a junction can have an unlimited number of incoming links, not more than one of those links can be a pipeline.
trans-unit.target: While a junction can have an unlimited number of incoming links, not more than one of those links can be a pipeline.

trans-unit.source: The number of incoming sequence links is not constrained.
trans-unit.target: The number of incoming sequence links is not constrained.

trans-unit.source: You will be allowed to create the junction with multiple incoming pipeline links and save the runbook, but it will fail when it is run.
trans-unit.target: You will be allowed to create the junction with multiple incoming pipeline links and save the runbook, but it will fail when it is run.

trans-unit.source: The example below is part of a runbook that starts a set of virtual machines while simultaneously downloading patches to be applied to those machines.
trans-unit.target: The example below is part of a runbook that starts a set of virtual machines while simultaneously downloading patches to be applied to those machines.

trans-unit.source: A junction is used to ensure that both processes are completed before the runbook continues.
trans-unit.target: A junction is used to ensure that both processes are completed before the runbook continues.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Junction</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Junction</linkText>

trans-unit.source: A cycle is when a destination activity links back to its source activity or to another activity that eventually links back to its source.
trans-unit.target: A cycle is when a destination activity links back to its source activity or to another activity that eventually links back to its source.

trans-unit.source: Cycles are currently not allowed in graphical authoring.
trans-unit.target: Cycles are currently not allowed in graphical authoring.

trans-unit.source: If your runbook has a cycle, it will save properly but will receive an error when it runs.
trans-unit.target: If your runbook has a cycle, it will save properly but will receive an error when it runs.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cycle</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cycle</linkText>

trans-unit.source: A loop is when you repeat an activity a specified number of times or keep repeating it until a particular condition is met.
trans-unit.target: A loop is when you repeat an activity a specified number of times or keep repeating it until a particular condition is met.

trans-unit.source: Loops are currently not supported in graphical runbooks.
trans-unit.target: Loops are currently not supported in graphical runbooks.

trans-unit.source: Any data that is output by an activity with an outgoing link is written to the databus for the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Any data that is output by an activity with an outgoing link is written to the databus for the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Any activity in the runbook can use data on the databus to populate parameter values or include in script code.
trans-unit.target: Any activity in the runbook can use data on the databus to populate parameter values or include in script code.

trans-unit.source: An activity can access the output of any previous activity in the workflow.
trans-unit.target: An activity can access the output of any previous activity in the workflow.

trans-unit.source: How the data is written to the databus depends on the type of link on the activity.
trans-unit.target: How the data is written to the databus depends on the type of link on the activity.

trans-unit.source: For a pipeline, the data is output as multiples objects.
trans-unit.target: For a pipeline, the data is output as multiples objects.

trans-unit.source: For a sequence link, the data is output as an array.
trans-unit.target: For a sequence link, the data is output as an array.

trans-unit.source: If there is only one value, it will be output as a single element array.
trans-unit.target: If there is only one value, it will be output as a single element array.

trans-unit.source: You can access data on the databus using one of two methods.
trans-unit.target: You can access data on the databus using one of two methods.

trans-unit.source: First is using an Activity Output data source to populate a parameter of another activity.
trans-unit.target: First is using an Activity Output data source to populate a parameter of another activity.

trans-unit.source: If the output is an object, you can specify a single property.
trans-unit.target: If the output is an object, you can specify a single property.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Activity output</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Activity output</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can also retrieve the output of an activity in a PowerShell Expression data source or from a Workflow Script activity with an ActivityOutput variable.
trans-unit.target: You can also retrieve the output of an activity in a PowerShell Expression data source or from a Workflow Script activity with an ActivityOutput variable.

trans-unit.source: If the output is an object, you can specify a single property.
trans-unit.target: If the output is an object, you can specify a single property.

trans-unit.source: ActivityOutput variables use the following syntax.
trans-unit.target: ActivityOutput variables use the following syntax.

trans-unit.source: The same guidance for setting <linkText>checkpoints</linkText><title></title> in your runbook applies to graphical runbooks.
trans-unit.target: The same guidance for setting <linkText>checkpoints</linkText><title></title> in your runbook applies to graphical runbooks.

trans-unit.source: You can add an activity for the Checkpoint-Workflow cmdlet where you need to set a checkpoint.
trans-unit.target: You can add an activity for the Checkpoint-Workflow cmdlet where you need to set a checkpoint.

trans-unit.source: You should then follow this activity with an Add-AzureAccount in case the runbook starts from this checkpoint on a different worker.
trans-unit.target: You should then follow this activity with an Add-AzureAccount in case the runbook starts from this checkpoint on a different worker.

trans-unit.source: Most runbooks in Azure Automation will require authentication to Azure resources.
trans-unit.target: Most runbooks in Azure Automation will require authentication to Azure resources.

trans-unit.source: The typical method used for this authentication is the Add-AzureAccount cmdlet with a <linkText>credential asset</linkText><title></title> that represents an Active Directory user with access to the Azure account.
trans-unit.target: The typical method used for this authentication is the Add-AzureAccount cmdlet with a <linkText>credential asset</linkText><title></title> that represents an Active Directory user with access to the Azure account.

trans-unit.source: This is discussed in <linkText>Configuring Azure Automation</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: This is discussed in <linkText>Configuring Azure Automation</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can add this functionality to a graphical runbook by adding a credential asset to the canvas followed by an Add-AzureAccount activity.
trans-unit.target: You can add this functionality to a graphical runbook by adding a credential asset to the canvas followed by an Add-AzureAccount activity.

trans-unit.source: Add-AzureAccount uses the credential activity for its input.
trans-unit.target: Add-AzureAccount uses the credential activity for its input.

trans-unit.source: This is illustrated in the following example.
trans-unit.target: This is illustrated in the following example.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Authentication activities</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Authentication activities</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You have to authenticate at the start of the runbook and after each checkpoint.
trans-unit.target: You have to authenticate at the start of the runbook and after each checkpoint.

trans-unit.source: This means adding an addition Add-AzureAccount activity after any Checkpoint-Workflow activity.
trans-unit.target: This means adding an addition Add-AzureAccount activity after any Checkpoint-Workflow activity.

trans-unit.source: You do not need an addition credential activity since you can use the same
trans-unit.target: You do not need an addition credential activity since you can use the same

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Activity output</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Activity output</linkText>

trans-unit.source: A runbook may require input either from a user when they start the runbook through the Azure preview portal or from another runbook if the current one is used as a child.
trans-unit.target: A runbook may require input either from a user when they start the runbook through the Azure preview portal or from another runbook if the current one is used as a child.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have a runbook that creates a virtual machine, you may need to provide information such as the name of the virtual machine and other properties each time you start the runbook.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have a runbook that creates a virtual machine, you may need to provide information such as the name of the virtual machine and other properties each time you start the runbook.

trans-unit.source: You accept input for a runbook by defining one or more input parameters.
trans-unit.target: You accept input for a runbook by defining one or more input parameters.

trans-unit.source: You provide values for these parameters each time the runbook is started.
trans-unit.target: You provide values for these parameters each time the runbook is started.

trans-unit.source: When you start a runbook with the Azure preview portal, it will prompt you to provide values for the each of the runbook's input parameters.
trans-unit.target: When you start a runbook with the Azure preview portal, it will prompt you to provide values for the each of the runbook's input parameters.

trans-unit.source: You can access input parameters for a runbook by clicking the Input and output button on the runbook toolbar.
trans-unit.target: You can access input parameters for a runbook by clicking the Input and output button on the runbook toolbar.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Runbook Input Output</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Runbook Input Output</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This opens the Input and Output control where you can edit an existing input parameter or create a new one by clicking Add input.
trans-unit.target: This opens the Input and Output control where you can edit an existing input parameter or create a new one by clicking Add input.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add input</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add input</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Each input parameter is defined by the properties in the following table.
trans-unit.target: Each input parameter is defined by the properties in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: The unique name of the parameter.
trans-unit.target: The unique name of the parameter.

trans-unit.source: This can only contain alpha numeric characters and cannot contain a space.
trans-unit.target: This can only contain alpha numeric characters and cannot contain a space.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: An optional description for the input parameter.
trans-unit.target: An optional description for the input parameter.

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Data type expected for the parameter value.
trans-unit.target: Data type expected for the parameter value.

trans-unit.source: The Azure preview portal will provide an appropriate control for the data type for each parameter when prompting for input.
trans-unit.target: The Azure preview portal will provide an appropriate control for the data type for each parameter when prompting for input.

trans-unit.source: Mandatory
trans-unit.target: Mandatory

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether a value must be provided for the parameter.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether a value must be provided for the parameter.

trans-unit.source: The runbook cannot be started if you do not provide a value for each mandatory parameter that does not have a default value defined.
trans-unit.target: The runbook cannot be started if you do not provide a value for each mandatory parameter that does not have a default value defined.

trans-unit.source: Default Value
trans-unit.target: Default Value

trans-unit.source: Specifies what value is used for the parameter if one is not provided.
trans-unit.target: Specifies what value is used for the parameter if one is not provided.

trans-unit.source: This can either be Null or a specific value.
trans-unit.target: This can either be Null or a specific value.

trans-unit.source: Data created by any activity that does not have an outgoing link will be added to the <linkText>output of the runbook</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Data created by any activity that does not have an outgoing link will be added to the <linkText>output of the runbook</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The output is saved with the runbook job and is available to a parent runbook when the runbook is used as a child.
trans-unit.target: The output is saved with the runbook job and is available to a parent runbook when the runbook is used as a child.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learning Windows PowerShell Workflow</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learning Windows PowerShell Workflow</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Automation assets</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Automation assets</linkText><title></title>
